name: Experimental Prototypes
description:
A collection of game proptotypes and proof-of-concepts that explore ideas that can be developed in collaboration with Children's Hospices Across Scotland (CHAS).

Bealix (July 2019) simulates the sport of archery with a boat-sailing environment. The player must target baskets that have balloons attached to them, causing them to float into the sky. By using a bow-and-arrow, players shoot at targets on the baskets to earn points. A leaderboard provides information on the high scores. This game was developed in collaboration between Children's Hospices Across Scotland (CHAS), Abertay University, and students from Perfect World, Beijing.

Viking Soccer (July 2019) is a player-versus-player arena-sports game in which players try to move a ball into the opposition’s goal to score points. Players move forwards automatically in a steady motion to simulate the notion of ice-skating, while they also have the ability to kick the ball or the player to gain a competitive advantage. This game was developed in collaboration between Children's Hospices Across Scotland (CHAS), Abertay University, and students from Perfect World, Beijing.

The King of Fencing (July 2019) is a player-versus-player game based on the sport of fencing. The objective of the game is for a player to strike their opponent with their fencing sword in order to earn points, with the player with the most points at the end of the game is declared the winner. This game was developed in collaboration between Children's Hospices Across Scotland (CHAS), Abertay University, and students from Perfect World, Beijing.

To donate to CHAS, please visit chas.org.uk/donate.
